p: The COVID‐19 global health emergency has resulted in increased anxiety, fear, depression and other negative emotions among civilians. 29 Studies have shown that approximately half of the survivors of malignant tumors have moderate fear of cancer recurrence. 30 Coupled with epidemic, lung cancer patients may worry about COVID‐19 and the impact of delayed antitumor treatment on their own treatment efficacy, which makes them more predisposed to anxiety, depression, and insomnia. We recommend that lung cancer patients may utilize association, relaxation exercises, appropriate venting to eliminate negative emotions, 31 and use online psychological consultations and interventions if necessary. 32
